'Hey, Sho?'%K%P
'What's up, Mai-chan?'%K%P
'I saw this thing on TV the other day.\nSometimes people who are really close\ngo from being friends to being a couple.'%K%P
'Do you think we could be a couple someday?'%K%P
'Hm, I dunno. A couple's like a\nmom and a dad, right?\nCould we really become like that?'%K%P
'Aw, you don't want to?'%K%P
'Th-That's not it! Uh, how 'bout this?'%K%P
'When I'm grown up, and\nbig and strong enough to\ntake care of you--'%K%P
A few days had passed since Sho started running\naround trying to restore Akane's motivation.%K%P
'Good! That's great, Akane!'%K%P
'Right? And just get a load of this!'%K%P
'Akane, I think something like this would work\nbetter there.'%K%P
As usual, Sho and Inori were in the courtyard\ncoaching Akane on her dance routine.%K%P
'You think so?'%K%P
'Yes. You see, this will be a little more showy...'%K%P
From my hidden vantage point I heaved a sigh.%K%P
Sho had thrown himself wholeheartedly\ninto helping out Akane.%K%P
I couldn't tell how Akane felt, but she did\nseem to be taking all this training seriously.%K%P
And Inori was always there to lend a hand.%K%P
As for me...\nIt didn't feel like I was doing a lot.%K%P
Of course, I said I wanted to save this building\nand that I'd do anything I could to help.%K%P
But none of it felt real.%K%P
'What can I do...?'%K%P
I was at a loss.%K%P
I'd been putting up a front for so long. I didn't\neven know how I truly felt anymore.%K%P
'What do I want, really...?'%K%P
Did I want to save Tsubaki Apartments,\nor just let it go?%K%P
I muttered to myself softly so that no one else\ncould hear.%K%P
'You're going to see your boss?'%K%P
'Yes. I received a call from her asking both Akane\nand I to come discuss matters in person.'%K%P
It wasn't until morning practice was over and\nwe'd finished lunch, that Inori brought it up.%K%P
'Sounds boooring, do I really have to go?'%K%P
'Yes, you do. It may be boring,\nbut it's also important.'%K%P
'Fine, fine, I'll go, I'll go.'%K%P
'Once is enough.\nIn any case... Sho, Maika?'%K%P
'I'm afraid Akane and I will be leaving now.'%K%P
'What?!'%K%P
'Huh? Something wrong, Maika?'%K%P
'Oh, uh, it's nothing...\nSo you're leaving me\nalone with Sho?'%K%P
She muttered something under her breath,\nbut I let it go.%K%P
'Will you be staying for dinner?'%K%P
'I'm not sure. We could be back by evening...\nIf nothing goes wrong, that is.'%K%P
'Why are you looking at me?\nAre you suggesting I'll do something\nto mess it up?!'%K%P
'Yes, something like flying off the handle at our\nboss...'%K%P
'You get angry way more than I do.'%K%P
'Did you say something?'%K%P
'No, nothing...'%K%P
'This being the case, we may be away overnight.'%K%P
'Urgh, this sucks!\nI want to eat Maika's cooking!'%K%P
Akane began to sulk.%K%P
'How about we make something you can\nreheat when you get back?'%K%P
'Oh, thank you. That would be great.'%K%P
'If you truly want to get home early, be sure to\ntake this meeting seriously.'%K%P
'Urrrgh... Okay, fine.'%K%P
With a reluctant nod, Akane followed after Inori\nand they both left the building.%K%P
With the two of them gone, it seemed\nawfully quiet.%K%P
They'd been here so long the place felt\nempty without them.%K%P
'What should we make for dinner...?\nHow about curry!'%K%P
'Maika?'%K%P
'Huh? What?'%K%P
'What about dinner?\nWe need to make something\nthat's easy to reheat.'%K%P
'Anything's good, right?\nWhy would we need to reheat it?'%K%P
'Were you even listening to Inori?'%K%P
'Oh... Yeah, sorry.\nI was just...thinking.'%K%P
'Something on your mind?\nDo you want to talk about it?'%K%P
'N-No, it's nothing serious. I'm fine, really.'%K%P
She didn't sound fine. She'd been acting strange\nfor a little while now.%K%P
'So, what was the problem about Inori?'%K%P
'She and Akane have to meet with their boss,\nthey might be home late. So I thought we'd\nmake dinner for when they get back.'%K%P
'Okay, sounds good.'%K%P
Maika still sounded distracted, like her mind was\nsomewhere else.%K%P
'You sure you're all right?\nYou can go take a nap or\nsomething if you like.'%K%P
'I'm fine. Besides, I've got chores to take care of.'%K%P
'Let me help you with that, then.'%K%P
Maika had already got up and was halfway\nto the door.%K%P
'It's okay. You should rest.\nYou must be tired from helping Akane\nwith her practice every day.'%K%P
'There's no way I can relax at a time like this.\nBesides, the housework'll get done faster\nwith two of us, right?'%K%P
'I guess...'%K%P
'Then it's settled.\nI'll wash up the breakfast stuff if you can handle\nthings out here. Sound good?'%K%P
'Sure.'%K%P
'Great. Let's get started.'%K%P
I flexed my arms a little and headed for the kitchen.%K%P
When I finished up in there, I went looking for Maika\nto see if she needed help with anything else.%K%P
There was something odd about her today.%K%P
'She seemed fine at breakfast, but now...\nIs she sick or something?'%K%P
I had no idea.%K%P
Asking her directly wouldn't get me anywhere.\nIt still bothered me, though.%K%P
'Oh, here you are.'%K%P
'You're done already? That was fast.'%K%P
'There wasn't that much to do.\nLooks like you're almost finished, too.'%K%P
'Yeah, almost.\nYou can head on ba--'%K%P
'No, I can still work. Here, give me a cloth.'%K%P
'Okay...'%K%P
I took one of Maika's spare cleaning\ncloths and stood next to her, wiping down\nany areas she'd missed.%K%P
'I guess you can't reach up here, huh?'%K%P
'Yeah, but...you really don't have to help\nlike this, you know.'%K%P
'I want to. I've been spending so much time\nwith Akane and Inori lately, it's nice to be able\nto do something for you.'%K%P
'Oh really? And what would you do for me?'%K%P
'For you, anything!'%K%P
'Jeez, enough with the cheesy lines.'%K%P
Maika smiled.%K%P
She was acting a little more like herself now.%K%P
'This is...kinda strange, huh?'%K%P
'What is?'%K%P
'It's been a while since you and I have been\nalone together.'%K%P
'Up until a while ago it was always just\nthe two of us here, but now it feels weird\nwithout Akane and Inori around.'%K%P
'I'm not saying it's a bad thing. Just...'%K%P
'Just...?'%K%P
'Forget it. It's nothing.'%K%P
What had she been trying to say?%K%P
I could only guess she was struggling with\nsomething she couldn't put into words.%K%P
'Hey Maika.\nAre you sure you're okay?'%K%P
'Of course I am. Why wouldn't I be?'%K%P
'You're lying.'%K%P
I looked straight into Maika's eyes.%K%P
'What makes you say that?'%K%P
She turned away to avoid my gaze. But I knew.%K%P
'How long have we known each other?\nBy now I can at least tell\nwhen you're not being honest.'%K%P
She didn't say a word.%K%P
But in a way, that silence was answer enough for me.%K%P
'You know I'll do anything I can\nto help, right?'%K%P
'Thanks. But really, it's nothing.'%K%P
'If you say so...'%K%P
It wouldn't do any good to try to pressure\nMaika into saying more.%K%P
I knew that, but I still wished I could do something.%K%P
'This isn't something I can tell you...'%K%P
'What was that?'%K%P
'I said enough chatter!\nIf you're gonna work,\nthen get to work!'%K%P
'Yes ma'am!'%K%P
Maika's expression was a perfect mask.\nIt could have meant anything.%K%P
I'd just have to wait until she was ready to talk.%K%P
